website_summaries.verdict: Unless you need frequent deep tissue massages, this roller is more than adequate for relief from muscle aches.
pros: Garners praise for its fast relief from tight muscles
Made by a trusted industry company
Comes in various colors and two size options

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP FAKE COPY
customer_reviews.text: This product is trash. It's not real Gaiam and is a poor quality imitation. It's a cheap copy and deformed after a single use. I attached comparison photos to my mom's genuine Gaiam roller and you can CLEARLY see the difference. Do NOT buy this product and you can save yourself the trouble. I'll be reporting this copycat product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My roller doesn’t roll!
customer_reviews.text: I have really been looking forward to this bundle.... and now I am still on the search. My foam roller came looking like an hour glass. The shape is all jacked up and the texture is bumpy. I’ve never wrote an amazon review but after I received this I went straight to the reviews to see if others had received their roller in similar condition. VERY disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for physical therapy. I wanted a very firm roller, this one does not disappoint. Before making my selection, I read numerous reviews of other products. Most of the negative reviews I read were either the roller arrived deformed, or the foam material separated when in use, neither is the case with this roller. I have used this roller twice daily for two months and it is in the same condition as when it first arrived. Would definitely recommend for those seeking a roller for physical therapy exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Last Chance

customer_reviews.title: Firm but not too hard.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as an alternative to the highly ranked one I bought before (an Amazon choice one). It is a good firmness for someone using it for physical therapy.The other one I ordered was WAY too hard and this one seems to be just a bit softer, but still structurally firm enough not to squish down when I use it. I am about 150 lbs. and haven't seen any squishing or deforming even after laying on it every day twice a day for a few weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: SoccerGirl70

customer_reviews.title: Dear Gaiam customer service, I had two Gaiam Foam ...
customer_reviews.text: Dear Gaiam customer service, I had two Gaiam Foam. I just bought this third one and it was not the same firm that I had. I am using both old and new ones, and the new one we just bought was soft. I think this is fake product...
customer_reviews.author: Trent M Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: there's a note taped inside the box with a web address if you'd like ideas. I have nothing to compare this to
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with false advertising!!!! There is no advertised DVD...there's a note taped inside the box with a web address if you'd like ideas. I have nothing to compare this to..but I was told to get a 'medium' density foam roller...which this stated it was...it's about as hard as a rock! Not often that I am unhappy with an Amazon item...but this is a loser!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Sims

customer_reviews.title: A foam roller is good for the muscles....
customer_reviews.text: I use this foam roller to improve my calf muscles. I have been dealing with plantar fasciitis for years and, for me, the foam roller seems to help my calf muscles. It may not help anyone else but it does me so that is what it counts.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Roller lost resistance in one month.
customer_reviews.text: I went with Gaiam as I trusted the brand. However this roller gave out after a month of use. It now looks like a sand glass with the pinch in the middle and it’s basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeElectr@nics

customer_reviews.title: So useful
customer_reviews.text: I have degenerative disc disease and deal with a fair amount of pain from it. Rolling and stretching on this helps me immeasurably. It's a good size and nice and solid with just enough give. My cat loves it, too. Thankfully the puncture holes don't affect it's functionality. ;)
customer_reviews.author: dreamyraynbo

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this roller
customer_reviews.text: Within barely two months of lightly using this item (maybe a few times a week), I noticed it has lost its shape and support and has buckled in the middle. I have paid less for foam rollers that lasted for years of heavy use! I thought that for the price this would perform better. And I can't return it since it has been over a month. Do not waste your money! This is a piece of trash!!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Prange

customer_reviews.title: Good length and width, texture makes it easy to control
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with using the longer, smooth surfaced rollers at my gym, even after a roller-focused session with my trainer. After suspending my gym membership because of COVID, I took more walks and hikes, but I didn’t spend much time stretching and doing other exercises. This led to some pain in my hips, knees, and along the outside of my legs. I realized I needed to mix up my routine and add rolling, too. This shorter, wider roller is easy to use, and the textured surface makes it easy o control. It definitely helps relieve discomfort, along with adding some weight training and stretching. I like the length, too, which makes it more convenient to store and use.
customer_reviews.author: Tippy Claire

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Sore Muscle Relief!
customer_reviews.text: I CANNOT rave enough about foam rolling! I suffer from chronic back pain and even if I don’t have time for a full work our or stretching session, I just grab my roller and roll out my back and shoulders for a hot minute and it makes all the difference! It’s the best self-massager! Some have complained about their foam roller arriving dented or mishaped but mine was perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Love the length
customer_reviews.text: I have another Gaiam foam roller, but shorter. I wanted a longer one as I find it's easier for me to roll out my back. This is firm and does the job. Works great for IT band as well. Packaging was a little wonky, it came all by itself in a huge box. I'm sure there could have been other ways to package this without using a large box. Overall, happy with purchase and would buy this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Worth it probably
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and perfect resistance. Not too firm not too soft. Prefer this one to stretch rather than work out but both are possible. Worth the money especially is a particular color is on sale. Always liked this brand of foam roller.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for rolling out tight muscles
customer_reviews.text: This roller will do the trick if you want to stretch and lengthen your muscles. I bought the 36" model. I would recommend the youtube video by Ashley Borden for great tips on how to use the foam roller correctly. The first one arrived damaged and looked like a return from a prior order. The shipped a replacement immediately which arrived in perfect condition. The first time you use this you will see how tight your muscles are and it won't be a comfortable feeling. The roller is quite firm and doesn't seem like it will flatten out but I haven't used it that long.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine MurthaTop Contributor: Travel Guides & Tips

customer_reviews.title: This foamer is great for firm rolls
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Product got here quick and on time. Super firm as I have lower back pain and a weak core in general. This works for my L band and my upper back. Also the hip exercises work great too. Feel like new for a few hours. Just like going to a physical therapist session everyday except costs a lot less money.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Hard, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help stretch out my back for postural stretching. It’s quite firm, but I couldn’t find a long enough softer one to get. Once on it, it does feel great to just relax and let gravity do the pulling. It kind of hurts to get on and off it though, as it’s quite hard, bit once laying on, feels good!
customer_reviews.author: paris2012

customer_reviews.title: Works to relieve back tension
customer_reviews.text: We use this to help relieve tight and tense muscles in my back. Lay it on the floor and use daily before work to stretch and relieve tight muscles. Store in our coat closet and keep it close at hand. Ordered in multiple sizes to customize the needs of my body. Great help when you don't have time to go to the chiropractor.
customer_reviews.author: ljcnorcal

customer_reviews.title: Where's the DVD?
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this item twice and neither purchase included the DVD. It had a link to GAIAM You Tube videos but the orders did not include the DVD as included in the description. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to the world of rolling...
customer_reviews.text: Just started rolling and this is a good one for beginners - ie not too hard (feels hard enough if you've never done it) and no bumps. Not sure how long it will last but seems completely durable for now. Comes with a DVD (are we in 2003?) but it's available online on the Gaiam site just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Pia Nightingale

customer_reviews.title: Another great GAIAM product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that really gets the kinks out! I use this after weight training ro help with soarness in my legs and buns. This is very firm with no give so if you are new to foam rolling it does take some time to get used to it. They also provide links for some sample foam rolling workout vides to show how this can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Jnnie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for leg, back, arm pain.
customer_reviews.text: Best roller for massaging out legs, arms & back. I use it daily. It's hard, not squishy but that's how it works. Start easy rolling with lighter pressure & work up to pressure you can handle. Use on the ground or even against a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my current foam roller is only 2 feet long and I needed one that was 3 feet to do the stretched prescribed by my chiropractor. It's super sturdy and true to color. I would definitely recommend it to others!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Foam Roller Damaged & Soft
customer_reviews.text: I love Gaiam products, so I am very disappointed in this product. The DVD is helpful for me, but I will need to find another roller. Out of the package this foam roller was damaged looking, having dents all through it along the entire length of it. I have used other foam rollers a lot, and none of them should be like this which is squishy Styrofoam, you are, after all, going to be rolling your body over it. Don't buy this roller, it's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: This is what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a 36" roller at the gym with similar density to this one, but with Covid-19 I have to do my IT band massages at home. This one is 18" long which is good for travel and I have not rolled off of it yet! I initially got one made of a firmer material (EPP) and it was too hard - it was like rolling on a concrete log. This one (EVA) is good for massaging a tight IT band.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M

customer_reviews.title: Time and Tighten
customer_reviews.text: Watched Tone and Tighten on Instagram and the Dr of physical therapy showed how to use it. I had a pinched nerve, I use this everyday. Super easy exercise and I have not had anymore pain! Buy it and watch Jared Beckstrand.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Fine ... but wish I'd listened.  Go longer.
customer_reviews.text: Should've paid attention to all the reviews that said this roller is too short: It is too short. Even the accompanying video uses a longer roller. And, some of the exercises can't be done with this one. All that said - happy I have it. I'd never worked with a roller and wasn't sure I'd like it. Sold. IT band, quads, calfs --- rolling all of them out with this and, one day, I'll get a longer one. So, it does the the trick ... but wish I'd gone for the longer one. And, the video is a good way to get started thought I'm sure there are videos on YouTube that probably would've done the trick as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lumbard

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, next
customer_reviews.text: The material is squishy and the ends are concerningly easy to press in with one finger. In my case, the packaging itself made permanent dents in the roller, so I returned my item the same day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P.

customer_reviews.title: This is my new best friend.
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist instructed me to purchase a long foam roller. How did I play cello for 32 years and violin for the past 20 years before discovering the benefits of this contraption? I'm so hooked on my foam roller that I have a smaller roller I can fit in my suitcase. Seriously, don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: courtney yeates

customer_reviews.title: Foam is the perfect density
customer_reviews.text: Love the foam on this roller. It’s soft enough that you don’t feel like there’s a brick being pushed into your body, but it’s also firm enough that it hold your body weight without denting.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Neige

customer_reviews.title: Not dense enough, doesn't do the job like other rollers
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out to save a few bucks but it didn't do the job. When rolling out my back, it would cave in slightly and not massage/roll out the muscles
customer_reviews.author: Zack Freiman

customer_reviews.title: try another
customer_reviews.text: This is the first roller I have purchased. I have used the notched ones and much prefer this one. I am 5"7, and this is just the right length for me. I am able to fit from glutes to head without falling off and making hot spots. The DVD is fine to get you started. I initially liked this roller, but it didn't take very long for it to warp. Now that it isn't round any more, it doesn't work right. All users of this have been <150 lbs, so it really should have been able to hold up to use.
customer_reviews.author: KRISTEN LAWRENCE

customer_reviews.title: Surprising keeper
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this in our local gym and he wanted one for home during COVID 19 lockdown. He always liked it and I was never sure. Surprisingly I have come to like it too. It was help work out the stiffness in my muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect foam roller.
customer_reviews.text: I was really skeptical about using a foam roller in general. So I bought a small one at a store just to try it. It was fabulous, but you really need a 36 inch roller to work and stretch out each body part. The first time you use it, it hurts. But as soon as you get up you feel great. I slept so well after rolling I couldn't believe it. I could have bought this roller in the store, but the price was better on Amazon. Also, a DVD comes with the roller, but there are plenty of demos. on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: justjill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner roller!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner roller! I had been using a textured roller previously which was just torture for me. Found this one on amazon and was night and day. I am able to to use a roller without being in complete agony. The purple marble is also very cute!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Fiedorowicz

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Good quality! My gym has these so I wanted to get one for home too. I’m not petite and it has held up well to frequent use. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, great price in comparison to other stores. I was hesitate on the pain relief aspect of it but my Pilates teacher recommended it and it’s just brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: I finally broke down and bought my own because it was so amazing and have no regrets
customer_reviews.text: My sister has the same one and I had used hers on and off for quite some time. I finally bought an identical one for myself because I loved it so much and it is amazing! I have no regrets. It is the perfect way to start or end the day, or use in between. Stretch out your back by simply laying and rolling on it, or work out tension in other muscles on the back or front side of your body with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little foam
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how effective this foam roller would be. I didn't buy it for exercising as it is marketed, but to help relieve upper back tightness and kinks. It works better than the $200 inverter machine I purchased a month prior. It does help get some of those kinks out of the upper back. My wife complains of lower back soreness due to her work as an R.N. and I had her jump on it too, she too said it provided relief to her lower back. As an added bonus soreness to other parts of the body (ie. lower legs) are also relieved.
customer_reviews.author: Lisco

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Trigger Point Performance roller. I love that roller, but it was leaving ugly red marks on my back and my husband's too. That roller must pinch the skin as it rolls. The marks would remain for days after using it. They looked like scars. (A massage girl was mortified the first time she saw the marks that roller left on me!) This roller works just as well as that one and was about 1/2 the price. I keep it by my bed and use it almost nightly before I get in bed to loosen up my back. I've only had it a short time but it's working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Venesa

customer_reviews.title: item arrived with a small gouge in the side of the roller
customer_reviews.text: This is really helpful for rolling out muscle tightness in my legs. I was disappointed to find a small gouge in the surface ot the roller. I will keep it and just hope the surface does not shred further.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good balance between form and soft
customer_reviews.text: This is not as hard as the standard high density rollers, which is just perfect for me. It’s still very sturdy. I would not describe as “soft”, but rather a nice medium.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: This was NOT a beginner foam roller. Much too dense and firm for starting out. Not what I expected, at all and with no give. If you’re used to foam rolling and want something firm, then this is fine but there’s really no give it at all.
customer_reviews.author: shanghaifry

customer_reviews.title: Great roller
customer_reviews.text: This is my second roller. And I love it. It does it’s job it’s sturdy. I will recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy1

customer_reviews.title: The texture and density work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily, and the density is great for me. I just started working with a foam roller, and others were too hard. This gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Ugly
customer_reviews.text: This is the ugliest “marble” effect I have ever seen. It’s a foam roller and serves its purpose. It’s just ugly and does not look like the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Ktlovesamazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality muscle roller
customer_reviews.text: It works well to massage sore muscles or loosen them. I'm happy with the purchase. I use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, small profile, does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I got this roller for my partner that is pregnant and needing a little back therapy. She's been using it for a bit now and loves the feel, the size, and the ease at which she can work on her back. Me, the skeptic, finally gave it a try and I really like the results. It's very sturdy to provide the support needed in order to get a good stretch or crack or whatever on my back. We've used it for many different exercises and stretches and it's held up to everything we throw at it. Would definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: jonny_r

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with big cut in foam.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but arrived with a big cut in the foam. I bought a new roller, but it doesn't look brand new, so I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: stylingmom

customer_reviews.title: Way better than traditional stretching
customer_reviews.text: My PT recommended to start using the roller in place of traditional stretching. With the proper technique, this is way batter. One MUST learn correct techniques though.
customer_reviews.author: Brindle Girl

customer_reviews.title: Ok. Harder than expected.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. Gets the job done. Wish it had more give, as it’s way stiffer then the one my physical therapist uses with me, so it’s working, but is not exactly enjoyable to use.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Relief
customer_reviews.text: I am a sports official (on the older side - 52 years) and do quite a bit of running which really tightens my hamstrings. Tight hamstrings lead to more tight muscles in the buttocks and back. This roller has proved to eliminate or reduce those tight issues. I have now added the roller to my stretching routine, and my body is thanking me. This particular roller is nice, since it is shorter than some other rollers which is even better. The price was fantastic as well. Can't go wrong - but you do have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: imafoxhunter

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it was previously used.
customer_reviews.text: Super upset that this has clearly been opened and used before. It’s obviously been torn out of the box, and there is something gross that got inside the box. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh. Relief.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect density and size. Will last a long time. Very good quality. Nice color and pattern.
customer_reviews.author: T. Goudy

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: My husband was told to use this by his chiropractor. Ordered this one and it helped him from the first try. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: momof3nj

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality! This item is helpful to roll sore muscles and loosen them up. My whole family uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Segars

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Basic
customer_reviews.text: The foam roller is fine. Yes, a little softer than some other options, but adequate. The workout is not hard at all and I'm sort of scratching my head at the reviewers who say it is. And it's really only about 10 minute "workout." The DVD is 18 minutes long, but 8 minutes of it is advertising other Gaiam products. It won't work any miracles, but it's a respectful, simple and basic regimen of stretching.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia KSA

customer_reviews.title: Better than any I’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best rollers I have purchased. I have a couple of others and they are not as durable and do not work as well as this one. This is my third purchase of this one. I gave one to my son and he is just as pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H. Batts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect firmness for exercises
customer_reviews.text: This is just firm enough for physical therapy exercises, but it's not so firm that it causes back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: I have a Gaiam foldable yoga mat which I always take when traveling so I believe the company sells excellent products.
customer_reviews.text: I was encouraged to try this to help with flexibility. It's ok. I prefer stretching without an aid, and am not to fond of the shape of this Gaiam. I have a Gaiam foldable yoga mat which I always take when traveling so I believe the company sells excellent products.
customer_reviews.author: C. M-R

customer_reviews.title: Good color
customer_reviews.text: Great color, but a little soft for me, might need to buy a harder one latter.
customer_reviews.author: Ophelia

customer_reviews.title: Easy broken
customer_reviews.text: The product was broken one week after usage, which is not daily usage. I got the replaced one and has the broken line after three days as attached and not sure will it broken to two parts later.
customer_reviews.author: T.C

customer_reviews.title: Simple, soft-ish, and lasts.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for years and it works great. It’s a softer roller, so it’s great to keep behind the couch and use very casually. Simple, soft-ish, and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son who is an athletic 215lbs. In less than a month, the roller developed flat spots and was even crushed and compressed in the center which made the ends curl making it unusable in that it would not roll smoothly. This might be suitable for someone who weighed considerably less but I would not recommend this item based on our xperience
customer_reviews.author: Tx

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I use my foam roller most every day to relieve knots/tension in my upper back and also after I run to release knots in my legs and lower back. I have to say, it works great and the DVD is very helpful, but I wish it was longer (wider). I sometimes find myself rolling off the side, and I'm a petite person. I can imagine for a man, this would probably not stretch across his entire shoulder area. Nonetheless, it is a great little roller and stores away easily.
customer_reviews.author: @fowler_graham

customer_reviews.title: Helps with my back pain
customer_reviews.text: I use this roller mainly for stretching my back. I had a back injury about a year and a half ago and this gives me a lot of relief especially before bed, in the morning, and before exercising. I never use it on my lower back, though! It's not safe to use rollers on that part of the spine.
customer_reviews.author: kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Rolls away sore, tired muscled
customer_reviews.text: I love this roller! It does what it's supposed to do and massages while rolling tired, sore muscles. The 18" size is good for hitting the small and large muscle groups. It may be a little small for someone who's large who wants to roll all back muscles at the same time, but a great roller none the less.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I learned about foam rollers just recently from a massage therapist who recommended it to me for leg cramps and stiffness. I like that its not too long, just right for my needs and stores easier than a longer one. I have used it almost daily since I got it and have not had it warp too much on me, it is pretty rigid. Great for those that are needing a roller to use at home casually like myself. Really helps keep my legs less tight and feel more flexible!
customer_reviews.author: ionyka

customer_reviews.title: Good size for taller people
customer_reviews.text: I am a foam rolling newbie but I really like the size of this and it feels sturdy. I’m 5’8 and 190 lbs for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory, works for what it's intended to do
customer_reviews.text: I looked around at foam rollers to alleviate the multiple chronic pains I have in my back, neck & shoulders. You can spend more than this on them, and since this one came with the DVD, I thought it was a good buy. I'm happy with the roller itself, but the DVD is pretty much useless. I went through it one time, and after that I threw it away. It might serve some people, but it wasn't useful for me. But overall, as foam rollers go, this works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Rach_IP

customer_reviews.title: Great for lower back and hips!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a keeper! Helps to relieve pain as you role your hip and lower back over it. I would recommend to anyone just as my sister in law reccomend it to us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Product. Firm material. 36 inches in longer than I thought it was, but that makes it easier to get to weird places with the roller. The DVD is awesome. It is short, but it is a great start. I've never used on of these before but everyone raves about how much this reduces soreness. It significantly does if done after a rough workout. I am satisfied with it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Foam roller is uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really care for the yoga style on the CD. I'm used to Julian Michaels power yoga. I wanted to like the roller so it would help with my back's alignment, but the foam roller is pretty hard for being foam, and it found it really uncomfortable. Needless to say, I didn't stick with it. I'll probably sell it on eBay to recoup part of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: good but dents easily
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this roller for my IT band and my back. I really like that it helps with the pain in those areas however I have noticed that after about a week of use it started to dent a bit in the middle. I think if I were to order another roller I would probably get one that had the ridges and was a bit longer. This works for what I need it to do but I don't think it is going to last for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Education

customer_reviews.title: Much bigger and harder than I was thinking it would be
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work for me because it was much too hard and thick.
customer_reviews.author: mtntrtl

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I use my Gaiam foam roller after a cardio work-out and basic stretch routine. I find that the roller is more effective when my muscles are warm. It is fantastic for massaging out sore spots and helps releive tension in places that are really hard to stretch (shoulders, hips and neck for me.) The video that came with the foam roller has some great ideas for using the foam roller and I also found some great routines on YouTube. (I really like Caroline Jordan's foam roller routines.)
customer_reviews.author: Mint-Chocolate-Chip

customer_reviews.title: Worthless.  Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. After using it for a few minutes started to break down and lose it's round shape. Due to this it won't roll and makes it unusable. Very disappointed as I purchased this to use on our vacation and now I don't have a roller. Will definitely be returning it. Save your money and buy the longer version - it works and retains its shape. Also they didn't send the DVD with it either.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for years! So, i ordered one for my dad, cousin, and uncle! They all love it
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Jay

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and just enough stiffness. Great for beginners but also hard enough to get a good massage. Also comes with a dvd!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my PT stretches
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. I have a shorter one but I needed a longer one due to the different type of exercises required. It's sturdy and provides the needed firmness.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Does help.
customer_reviews.text: This really works as advertised. My daughter suggested I get it to relieve some pain in my shoulder. After aprox. a week of using it I could feel less pain and am keeping it down by regular use. I did end up purchasing a book so that I could use it in many different ways. I consider this to be a good purchase indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Zazen

customer_reviews.title: I love using this everyday
customer_reviews.text: This product really works to stretch muscles & fascia, adjust misalignments and even helps with reducing cellulite. I love using this everyday. It's so easy and it works. The video is helpful too. I use it on my back and it works amazing to adjust my spine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good DVD, foam roller not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I liked the DVD and it showed some good ideas on how to use the foam roller. However, the foam roller flattened out within 4 months of use. I'm not a big person, I weigh 128 lbs and was very disapointed that after only 4 months I can't roll on it anymore. I had to go out and buy a second foam roller that is much stiffer and made out of a different material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roller did not roll
customer_reviews.text: I have back problems, and I was hoping this roller would help. But I was not able to get this roller to roll at all. The only thing it did is make my back hurt more. Getting down on the floor and having this roller against my back was very uncomfortable. I also seemed to be slipping off the roller or almost falling off it. The foam roller is slippery. It just did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Cat Street

customer_reviews.title: Firm but not hard
customer_reviews.text: Seems durable. Only used a few times but I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie F.

customer_reviews.title: Lost its shape fast
customer_reviews.text: Great product in theory but mine lost its shape very quickly and I’m a very average sized adult.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. So simple and effective. I roll my back on it every night before I climb into bed. I noticed a difference on the first use!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Hack

customer_reviews.title: NO DVD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product specifically for the "included" DVD. It did not come with one.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: The workout is very good, but the roller doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I only used the roller several times per week for 3 weeks when it began to flatten and wouldn't roll very well. I enjoy the roller workout that comes with it -- which is mostly yoga on the roller, but I wish the foam held up to the workout longer than a few weeks. I can see myself buying these in an endless string. NOT.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer with back and neck pain. I can easily get my back to pop when I lay down on this it’s perfect and massages well when you roll on it. I recommend to friends and family all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Muscle Therapy
customer_reviews.text: I just had lower back surgery 5 months ago. I do daily streatches and I practice yoga 3 days a week and pilates the other days. Adding the roller to my workout has been an amazing addition to my practices. The physical benefits are longlasting. The aches and pains have truly lessened. When I feel to stiff to do anything, and have a lot of pain, I start with the roller to help give me the relief I need to go on with my day
customer_reviews.author: stephanie lax

customer_reviews.title: foam roller
customer_reviews.text: I received my foam roller but without the DVD that it says was included in the order. I'm very dissappointed, because I bought the roller out of so many of them because and only because there was a DVD included in it Sorry just found the dvd, I changed my ratings. I dont know how to cancel my first rating.
customer_reviews.author: viktoria

customer_reviews.title: The dvd helped tremendously
customer_reviews.text: I was given exercises from my physical therapist using a foam roller. I didn't want to spend what they would have charged me, so I came to Amazon to look for one. The DVD was helpful since I couldn't remember all of them and they were actually on it. Just with the roller was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jamy Valadez

customer_reviews.title: This foam roller is not as firm as some of ...
customer_reviews.text: This foam roller is not as firm as some of the high density ones. After using for about a week, you can visibly see the middle section that is being used the most is slightly thinner than the ends. This one does produce somewhat softer touch than the high density foams, if those are too hard for you.
customer_reviews.author: isaac

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love using the roller for stretching and working on my sore muscles between visits to the gym. Some days I come home from a long day at work and just need to stretch and work out some muscle kinks but don't feel like changing and going to the gym for a full workout.
customer_reviews.author: mhudders

customer_reviews.title: Firm and very useable!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice firm roller. My daughter showed me how she uses hers but this came with a DVD that shows much more than I could of have imagined. It is improving my posture!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Lahr

customer_reviews.title: Great for post-ride recovery
customer_reviews.text: I was a little dubious about using a roller for aiding recovery after my bike rides, but I was pleasantly surprised. This roller is great. I watched the DVD once but recalling its recommended stretches wasn't easy. As a result, I use the roller with six stretches Bicycling Magazine had in an article about a year ago. Search for foam roller.
customer_reviews.author: KentC

customer_reviews.title: Hard and stiff
customer_reviews.text: It is very stiff and hard. I have to fold over my yoga mat and lay it over the roller to use it.
customer_reviews.author: DaniB3

customer_reviews.title: foam roller
customer_reviews.text: Just like the one at the doctors office. It works just fine for its intended use. I haven't really watched and used DVD that it comes with. What I did see makes it all look very easy cause its a fit guy using the roller. For me its a little more difficult. nice to have DVD though.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: It is a great tool for keeping my back healthy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost 5 years. It is a great tool for keeping my back healthy. Regular rolling helps keep my muscles looser & the disks in alignment, reducing the need to visit the chiropractor. It has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Matters

product_meta.title: Gaiam Restore Muscle Massage Therapy Foam Rollers (18 inch & 36 inch)
product_meta.description: Roll your way to a stronger, healthier you. The Gaiam Restore Muscle Therapy Foam Roller loosens tight muscles to help improve mobility. The 18-Inch length allows for simultaneous double arm and double leg work to soothe soreness effectively.
feature_bullets: SEMI-FIRM DENSITY: Foam roller offers a medium density with minimal muscle stimulation
PERFECT SIZE: 18-Inch length allows for double arm and double leg work to soothe soreness effectively
LOOSEN TIGHT MUSCLES: Roll your way to a stronger, healthier you by helping to improve mobility and relieve stress
INCLUDES: 15-Minute 'How To' digital workout is included to help get you started

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
